metadata.title: CVE-2021-42252 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in aspeed_lpc_ctrl_mmap indrivers/soc/aspeed/aspeed-lpc-ctrl.c in the Linux kernel before 5.14.6.Local attackers able to access the Aspeed LPC control interface couldoverwrite memory in the kernel and potentially execute privileges, akaCID-b49a0e69a7b1. This occurs because a certain comparison uses values thatare not memory sizes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
